medical_history.chief_complaint: 3 days of right upper quadrant abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to admission, described as sharp, severe epigastric and RUQ pain that does not radiate to the back. The pain comes and goes in waves on a scale of minutes and has not changed in location. Some abdominal distension and associated shortness of breath (SOB) were noticed over the same period. Vomiting was clear/yellow and non-bloody. Partial relief was obtained from medication.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of type 2 diabetes mellitus, cirrhosis secondary to hepatitis C (upon interferon treatment), history of alcohol abuse (in remission), known hepatocellular carcinoma (post-cyberknife and RFA treatment), hypertension, gastroesophageal reflux disease, anxiety, and thrombocytopenia. Surgical history includes right carpal tunnel release, right knee medial meniscus surgery, inguinal hernia repair, and cholecystectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Daughter deceased from ovarian cancer. Mother's family has a history of myocardial infarction and stroke. Father's history includes panic disorder, agoraphobia, and alcoholism.
